author: Peter Moss
title: Comment on Los Angeles Fire Threatens Mt. Wilson Communication Transmitters by Peter Moss
text:
Los Angeles Fire Threatens Mt. Wilson Communication Transmitters
Elon Musk already promised free Starlink terminals.
The Eaton fire in Los Angeles has reached Mt. Wilson, which houses communication and broadcast transmitters.
Police and firefighters rely on those towers to communicate with each other. The destruction would also affect truck drivers using radios.
The majority of LA‚Äôs broadcast stations have antennas on Mt. Wilson. From Variety:
According to KCBS/KCAL news, hand crews have arrived at Mt. Wilson to fight the blaze.
Most of Los Angeles‚Äô TV stations broadcast from Mt. Wilson, including KCBS (CBS 2), KNBC (NBC 4), KTLA (Channel 5), KABC (ABC 7), KCAL (Channel 9), KTTV (Fox 11), KCOP (Channel 13), KCET (PBS SoCal 2 Channel 28), KOCE (PBS SoCal 1 Channel 50) and KMEX (Univision 34). FM stations broadcasting from there include KPCC-FM 89.3, KPFK-FM 90.7, KUSC-FM 91.5, KRRL-FM 92.3, KCBS-FM 93.1, KLLI-FM 93.9, KTWV 94.7, KLOS-FM 95.5, KNX-FM 97.1, KKLA-FM 99.5, KKLQ-FM 100.3, KRTH-FM 101.1, KSCA-FM 101.9, KIIS-FM 102.7, KOST-FM 103.5, KBIG-FM 104.3, KKGO-FM 105.1, KPWR-FM 105.9 and KLVE-FM 107.5.
üö®
[#BREAKING]: CRITICAL communication infrastructure is on the verge of being incinerated by the Eaton Fire in Los AngelesMost LA TV and radio stations have their antennas atop Mt. Wilson, including NBC, ABC, CBS, etc.
Today‚Äôs Starlink deliveries are now vital, as emergency‚Ä¶
[pic.twitter.com/YkIb4WZ0kC]‚Äî Nick Sortor (@nicksortor)
[January 9, 2025]
BREAKING üö®: Local News KTLA5 shows webcam viewing of Mt. Wilson catching fire.
Reporters say this WILL be CATASTROPHIC as this location has towers and satellites that Firefighters and Police are using now for communications. This will impact radio stations and TV NEWS!
[pic.twitter.com/g4CiDrt6ou]‚Äî Anthony (@AnthonyCabassa_)
[January 9, 2025]
The Famous Mt. Wilson Observatory staff announced the majority evacuated from the building, leaving behind a few to keep watch.
The Observatory has no power, limiting communication.
Elon Musk already promised Starlink terminals to the affected areas.
It seems TV stations have already used Starlink because cell towers aren‚Äôt working.
SpaceX will provide free Starlink terminals to affected areas in LA tomorrow morning
‚Äî Elon Musk (@elonmusk)
[January 9, 2025]

title: Cronaca meteo. Il ciclone tropicale Chido verso Madagascar e Mozambico. Venti a oltre 200km/h e piogge torrenz
text:
Cronaca meteo. Il ciclone tropicale Chido verso Madagascar e Mozambico. Venti a oltre 200km/h e piogge torrenziali in arrivo - Video
1 minuto, 15 secondi
Sull'Oceano Indiano Meridionale √® in azione il ciclone tropicale Chido, con la forza equivalente a quella di un uragano di categoria 3 e con raffiche di vento che superano i 200km/h. Nel suo spostamento verso ovest √® transitato sulla piccola isola di Agalega, che dista circa 700km dal Madagascar ed √® abitata da poco pi√π di 300 abitanti. Si √® trattato del sistema tropicale pi√π forte ad aver colpito l'isola dal 1983 (quando vennero distrutte quasi tutte le infrastrutture dell'isola) e lo ha fatto con la forza equivalente a quella di un uragano di categoria 4 nella giornata di gioved√¨.
Tropical Cyclone Chido: Video of weather conditions in Agal a Island located in the Indian Ocean.
‚Äî RenderNature (@RenderNature)
Video captured on Wednesday afternoon (December 11, 2024).
[: Defi Media][#CycloneChido][#Agal a][pic.twitter.com/46ee1oo2gT][December 12, 2024]
Ora si trova alle coordinate 11.1S 49.9E, ovvero a un centinaio di chilometri a nord della costa settentrionale del Madagascar, dove le condizioni sono in forte peggioramento e si prevedono venti intorno a 200km/h con mareggiate e piogge di forte intensit√†. Il suo passaggio sar√† comunque rapido e nella giornata di sabato transiter√† in prossimit√† dell'isola di Mayotte, nel Canale di Mozambico, per poi dirigersi verso il Mozambico, dove far√† landfall nella giornata di domenica.
Tropical Cyclone
‚Äî YouStorm (@YouStormorg)[#Chido]has intensified to category 4 major hurricane strength, a highly dangerous storm with distinct eye. It passed directly over the Agal a Islands and is forecast to get very close to, or pass over the northern tip of Madagascar tomorrow.[#CycloneChido][pic.twitter.com/qg2lLsidwb][December 12, 2024]
Dopo aver toccato terra, Chido comincer√† a perdere energia ma sar√† ancora n grado di scaricare piogge torrenziali con probabili criticit√† idro-geologiche per inondazioni, frane e mareggiate. Successivamente, inoltrandosi nell'entroterra africano, potr√† coinvolgere anche lo stato del Malawi all'inizio della prossima settimana, con venti parzialmente indeboliti, ma con piogge di forte intensit√† e a carattere alluvionale.

author: Briana Zamora-Nipper
title: Houston‚Äôs frozen magic: Steamy spectacle unfolds as winter weather casts its spell ‚ùÑÔ∏è
text:
Houston, we have a winter wonderland! As freezing temperatures blanket the Houston area, something interesting is happening to our bodies of water ‚Äì steam rising off lakes and coastal waters. But fear not, it‚Äôs not a scene from a sci-fi movie; it‚Äôs a mesmerizing weather phenomenon that has captured the attention of Houstonians.
MORE: Model update on how cold Houston mornings will be Frozen ponds and coastal wonders üåä KPRC 2‚Ä≤s Click2Pins users were quick to share the breathtaking scenes with us. Photos and videos poured in, showcasing the surreal spectacle of steam dancing above the water. The wintry weather has turned ordinary lakes and coastal areas into a mystical landscape, with the cold air creating a striking contrast against the relatively warmer waters.

Houston Winter weather extravaganza ü•∂ Bundled in layers, Southeast Texas woke up to a winter spectacle this morning as scattered light wintry mixes unfolded across the region. The National Weather Service‚Äôs forecast for Houston and Galveston offers a glimpse into the chilly days ahead. The day promises lingering light freezing rain, drizzle, and the occasional snow or sleet until late afternoon.
Brace yourselves for the evening, as winds are set to become breezy to windy, with gusts of 20 to 25 mph inland and even higher along the coast.
The combination of brisk north winds and plummeting temperatures will usher in frigid wind chill values tonight and persist through Tuesday night into Wednesday morning.
Maritime enthusiasts are forewarned, with hazardous conditions expected due to strong north winds and elevated seas. Small Craft Advisories are in effect for bays and Gulf waters, and a Gale Warning has been upgraded from late tonight through noon Tuesday. Houstonians are urged to stay weather-aware as Winter Weather Advisories, Wind Chill Advisories, and Hard Freeze Warnings pepper the forecast.
RELATED: Track the Texas power grid: Here‚Äôs how to monitor ERCOT‚Äôs current grid conditions in real-time What‚Äôs your winter view like? üì∏ We want to see it! Share your snowy landscapes, frosty windows, or any other winter wonder you‚Äôre witnessing in your neighborhood with us at Click2Pins . We love showcasing your captivating photos on-air and online.

author: Russia Today
title: NATO base in Germany on alert for ‚Äòpotential threat‚Äô ‚Äî RT World News
text:
A NATO radar plane base in Geilenkirchen, Germany has raised its security level due to an intelligence warning about a potential threat.
Located near the German-Dutch border, the base is home to the NATO AWACS (airborne early warning and control systems) force, which became operational in 1988.
‚ÄúWe raised the security level at NATO Airbase Geilenkirchen based on intelligence information indicating potential threat,‚Äù the base announced on its X (formerly Twitter) account on Thursday evening.
‚ÄúAll non-mission essential staff have been sent home as a precautionary measure,‚Äù the base added. ‚ÄúOperations continue as planned.‚Äù
The threat level at the base has been raised to Charlie, a spokesperson told Reuters. This is the second-highest of four states of alert, and means there has either been an incident, or intelligence, indicating that some kind of terrorist attack is ‚Äúhighly likely.‚Äù
Read more Potential breach detected at military base of NATO member Geilenkirchen reported an attempted trespassing incident last week that triggered a full security sweep at the base. On the same day, the Wahn barracks, which serve the military part of Cologne Bonn Airport, were put on lockdown as authorities investigated reports that the water supply had been contaminated. Test results later showed no issues with the tap water, however.
On Thursday, the authorities launched an investigation after unidentified drones were seen flying over critical infrastructure in the northern part of the country.
NATO has ramped up warnings about possible sabotage by Russia in recent months, even as it has increased its supply of weapons, ammunition and equipment to Ukraine. The US and its allies have insisted that provisioning Kiev does not make them a party to the conflict, shrugging off Russia‚Äôs repeated insistence otherwise.

author: @CSIMarket
title: Allied Gaming Bounces Back: Strategic investment from Elite Fun Entertainment, A Stepping-Stone to Recoveryn From Setback to Comeback: Allied Gaming and Entertainment Inc. Leverages Investment from Elite Fun Entertainment amidst Revenue Slump.
text: Allied Gaming Bounces Back: Strategic investment from Elite Fun Entertainment, A Stepping-Stone to Recoveryn From Setback to Comeback: Allied Gaming and Entertainment Inc. Leverages Investment from Elite Fun Entertainment amidst Revenue Slump. Published / Modified Dec 28 2023 CSIMarket Team / CSIMarket.com Allied Gaming & Entertainment,Inc. (NASDAQ: AGAE) is not just a company; it is the harbor of imaginative and immersive entertainment experiences delivered across the globe.By making supreme use of advanced technology and interactive exhibits, AGAE unfailingly presents its clients with a one-of-a-kind entertainment experience that surpasses the conventional norms of amusement. Their quality services have been appreciated far and wide, and they stand as a trusted name in the global entertainment industry. On the other hand, Elite Fun Entertainment Co., an influential purveyor of cultural and theatrical affairs in Macau, is equally distinguished for its prowess in directing live events across Asia, and especially in the thriving area of China's Greater Bay. This expertize has given them a significant position amidst the Asian cultural and entertainment sectors. This investment by Elite Fun Entertainment is viewed as a dynamic collaboration that couples the robust experiential entertainment capacities of AGAE with the live event mastery of the investing company. Despite a tough financial quarter for Allied Gaming & Entertainment Inc., which saw a revenue slump of 28.47% YoY in Q3 2023, this move seems to be a well-thought-out play in the grander scheme of things. While most of AGAE's competitors reported an average revenue surge of 5.38% in the same period, Allied Gaming & Entertainment Inc. managed to attain higher profitability. With a substantial net margin of 6.72%, AGAE outshines its competitors regarding profitability metrics. The 3rd quarter also saw Allied Gaming and Entertainment Inc. turn a corner, bringing home a net profit of $0.08 million, contrasting considerably with the net loss of $1.64 million it bore in the same quarter the previous year. As the collaboration crystalizes, all eyes remain on how AGAE uses this alliance to further leverage its profitability and turn revenue adversity into an opportunity. author: Eva Kolimar
title: AI careers take off: robots inspire students
text: It might look odd now, but one day in the not-too-distant future, you might not blink twice seeing a robot sit among humans in a school line-up. As part of a robotics incursion at Engadine High School, students got on the artificial intelligence (AI) bandwagon and got close to a robot with very lifelike features. Over 500 students from 16 high schools across the Sutherland Shire and St George have entered an AI Careers Immersion program this year. The initiative, supported by the Regional Industry Education Partnerships program under the NSW Department of Education, equips young people with the essential skills and knowledge to thrive in a rapidly evolving job market. Engadine High School was the first in NSW to welcome G1, a state-of-the-art humanoid robot from Unitree. As companies like BMW increasingly deploy humanoids in manufacturing, students gained hands-on exposure to the cutting edge of AI and robotics. The AI Careers Incursion program prepares students to lead in industries yet to be imagined by fostering lifelong learning and hands-on engagement with transformative technology. Trevor Adams from Regional Industry Education Partnerships emphasised the importance of such initiatives. "In today's fast-changing job landscape, connecting students with emerging technologies and local employers as early as possible is key," he said. "We know this has a massive impact on positive outcomes for students. These experiences empower students to explore future career pathways and develop the agility to adapt to evolving industries." The program inspired students to think critically about the impact of AI and robotics on their future. Vice Captain of Engadine High School, Holly, said: "I don't think the question is, 'What jobs can we use the humanoid for?' I think the question is, 'What jobs aren't we going to use the humanoids for?' The pace of technology and diversity of jobs remain the challenge." Students interacted with robotic dogs and humanoid robots, diving into AI and Mechatronic Engineering. Tara, a student in the enrichment class, was intrigued. "I was immediately very excited because the last time robots came to Engadine High with this program, we got to see quadrupeds, and this time it was a bipedal robot, so it was cool to see a humanoid, an advancement that has a lot of unknown potential," she said. Another student, Zac, reflected on the robot's future uses. "I think it will be useful for things that are too dangerous for humans to do or for it to do things humans don't want to," he said. To further their learning, students completed AI Microskills through the TAFE Institute of Applied Technology, taking their first steps toward becoming part of a workforce ready to embrace AI-driven opportunities. They also secured opportunities to participate in Cyber Security Work Experience, leveraging their knowledge from the program to explore another critical and rapidly growing field. Engadine High School principal Kerrie Jones praised the program. "Our students and the world they are inheriting are so very different from the world even five years ago," she said. We have no idea of the impact of such phenomenal technology. This will also be the next generation's challenge."
